title: Prevent an extra allocation and copy per imported file
Try guessing image format when MIME type is missing or invalid
body: When the MIME type is missing gltf can try guessing the file format by using `image::guess_format`.

title: Implement ExactSizeIterator for accessor::util::Iter
body:
This trait was implemented for `Iter` prior to 0.14. It appears that
the missing trait implementation was an oversight when sparse
accessors were implemented in #246.

title: Make buffer_views in sparse accessors optional
body:
Fixes #266

For those who use blender, current stable blender build actually doesn't currently support importing sparse accessors without buffer_views!

Reproducing the error message below:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/__init__.py", line 528, in execute
    return self.import_gltf2(context)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/__init__.py", line 549, in import_gltf2
    BlenderGlTF.create(self.gltf_importer)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/blender/imp/gltf2_blender_gltf.py", line 41, in create
    BlenderScene.create(gltf, scene_idx)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/blender/imp/gltf2_blender_scene.py", line 102, in create
    BlenderAnimation.anim(gltf, anim_idx, node_idx)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/blender/imp/gltf2_blender_animation.py", line 30, in anim
    BlenderNodeAnim.anim(gltf, anim_idx, node_idx)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/blender/imp/gltf2_blender_animation_node.py", line 104, in anim
    values = BinaryData.get_data_from_accessor(gltf, animation.samplers[channel.sampler].output)
  File "/Applications/Blender.app/Contents/Resources/2.80/scripts/addons/io_scene_gltf2/io/imp/gltf2_io_binary.py", line 52, in get_data_from_accessor
    bufferView = gltf.data.buffer_views[accessor.buffer_view]  # TODO initialize with 0 when not present!
TypeError: list indices must be integers or slices, not NoneType

location: <unknown location>:-1
```

title: Relax additional lifetimes
body:
Followup for #264. Tried to get everything, but good odds I missed a few corners.

Aside all the low hanging fruit, I made a couple more significant changes this time: the `Primitives` iterator and the `Primitive` struct itself now capture `Mesh` by value. This increases their size by two pointers in exchange for avoiding narrowing of lifetimes. An alternative approach would be to add a distrinct lifetime parameter for the `Mesh` references alone, but that would be a breaking change, and is less flexible. Considering how trivial these copies should be for LLVM to optimize, I think the chosen solution is ideal.

title: Relax proxy lifetimes
body:
Previously, every accessor method borrowed directly from its object, which makes certain traversals difficult. Instead, we can thread through a single same lifetime representing the root Gltf object.

Only updated `Scene` for now; this should probably be done pervasively, but I didn't want to put in the grunt work without buy-in.

title: Add support for KHR_materials_unlit
body:
Hi there,

I'd like to implement support for `KHR_materials_unlit` in my gltf viewer. Here is a PR adding support for it in gltf.

title: Fix warnings in examples
body: These warnings were added in a recent rust update.

title: Fix cubic spline docs
body:
I realized the docs here are just copied from the gltf spec, so I made a PR for this myself.

Probably closes https://github.com/gltf-rs/gltf/issues/259

Although I'm still not sure why the catmull rom spline is not in the gltf specs.

title: Revert "separate import from loading data"
body:
This doesn't achieve anything useful at the moment so I would prefer to leave it out of the next release. The crate doesn't include the `import` function with `--no-default-features --features import` and the crate fails to build with `--no-default-features --features import_data_reference`.

This reverts commit eeac166f66a4a8a0df8ba7b863d4cd9e506112d2.

title: Add slice import
body:
New version of #192 potentially a bit better

The error name is maybe not ideal

title: Update gltf-derive dependencies
body: This removes redundantly compiled crates (as imported from serde) speeding up compile times (approximately 2s on my machine).
